channel.title: version-control on Ottmar’s Notes
channel.description: Recent content in version-control on Ottmar’s Notes

item.title: DOAG Regionaltreffen 11. März 2019, München
item.description: Ich hatte die Ehre an einer gemeinsamen Veranstaltung der DOAG Regionalgruppe München und der Oracle APEX Meetup-Gruppe München einen Vortrag halten zu dürfen zu dem im Untertitel genannten Thema. Danke an Alle, die an dem Abend da waren. Der Raum war voll - wohl wegen Carsten Czarski und den von ihm vorgestellten APEX 19.1 Data Loading Features. Mit so vielen Teilnehmern macht das gleich doppelt Spaß. Für die Teilnehmer hier die Folien:

item.title: PLEX - PL/SQL Export Utilities
item.description: PLEX is a standalone PL/SQL package with export utilities. It was created to be able to quickstart version control for existing (APEX) apps and depends on APEX 5.1.4 or later for APEX_EXPORT and APEX_ZIP. It currently has two main functions called BackApp and Queries_to_CSV. Queries_to_CSV is used by BackApp as a helper function, but its functionality is also useful as a standalone. This post is all about BackApp, which has the following features:

item.title: APEX_EXPORT and Version Control
item.description: Since years it has been possible to export an APEX app definition with the help of APEXExport, a Java utility delivered within the APEX install zip file. There is also the possibility to split the file into its components like pages, plugins and so on. There are some blog postings available how to do this - simply ask Google. Also the Java based SQLcl has the capability to do the export of an APEX app directly.
